pages.text: A $(l:complicated_bees:machines/mellarium)Mellarium$() can produce thousands of combs every bee tick. You'll need something a little more powerful than a regular centrifuge (or even multiple!) to process those.$(br2)This is where the Gyrofuge comes in - a multiblock solution to your overproduction woes.

The Gyrofuge (without upgrades) processes combs in half the time and provides a baseline 1.5x multiplier to product chance. The Gyrofuge can be upgraded using modules, similar to the Mellarium.$(br2)It is also important to note that $(l)non-base gyrofuge blocks can not be placed in the top layer$() of the Gyrofuge.$(br2)The Gyrofuge also uses a trickle of power even when not doing anything.
Try not to build these across chunk borders, or right next to each other.
Gyrofuge panels themselves can be made in the smithing table, combining an iron ingot, a Mellarium panel, and a redstone torch.

pages.title: Energy Cell
pages.text: To have a Gyrofuge accept energy, you'll need at least one of these.$(br2)Input and output hatches try to transfer as many items as the Gyrofuge can fit every 4 ticks.
Processing units increase the number of items processed at a time.
pages.title: Processing Units

pages.text: Speed units increase the speed a gyrofuge processes items at.
pages.title: Speed Units

pages.text: Efficiency units increase the energy efficiency of a gyrofuge.
pages.title: Efficiency Units

pages.text: Extraction units increase output chance for items processed in a gyrofuge.
pages.title: Extraction Units
